doyoumind.api package¶

Submodules¶

doyoumind.api.api module¶

class doyoumind.api.api.API(host, port, db_url)¶

Bases: object

driver = None¶
host = None¶
port = None¶
doyoumind.api.api.get_result(user_id, timestamp, result_name)¶

return the result of the snapshot’s topic’s parse.

doyoumind.api.api.get_result_data(user_id, timestamp, result_name)¶

for large data fields, returns the actual data of the parser. Returns a ‘bytes’ object.

doyoumind.api.api.get_snapshot(user_id, timestamp)¶

return the given topics for a snapshot. The snapshot is given by the id of its user, and by its timestamp. WARNING: it probably dosen’t support snapshots made before 1970

doyoumind.api.api.get_snapshots(user_id)¶

return the users’ snapshots (only their timestamps).

doyoumind.api.api.get_user(user_id)¶

returns a users’ details (not including the snapshots).

doyoumind.api.api.get_users()¶

returns a list of all users. Each entry contains the user id and username.

doyoumind.api.api.return_if_exists(result)¶
doyoumind.api.api.run_api_server(host='127.0.0.1', port=5000, database_url='mongodb://127.0.0.1:27017')¶

doyoumind.api.api_mongodb module¶

class doyoumind.api.api_mongodb.APIMongoDB(db_url)¶

Bases: object

get_result(user_id, timestamp, result_name)¶
get_snapshot(user_id, timestamp)¶

return the given topics for a snapshot. The snapshot is given by the id of its user, and by its timestamp. NOTE: the timestamp is given by a float. (num. of seconds since …)

get_snapshots(user_id)¶

return the users’ snapshots (only their timestamps).

get_user(user_id)¶

returns a users’ details (not including the snapshots)s.

get_users()¶

returns a list of all users. Each entry contains the user id and username.
